title: The Spectral Approach to Linear Rational Expectations Models. (arXiv:2007.13804v4 [econ.EM] UPDATED)
abstract: This paper considers linear rational expectations models in the frequency domain under general conditions. The paper develops necessary and sufficient conditions for existence and uniqueness of particular and generic systems and characterizes the space of all solutions as an affine space in the frequency domain. It is demonstrated that solutions are not generally continuous with respect to the parameters of the models, invalidating mainstream frequentist and Bayesian methods. The ill-posedness of the problem motivates regularized solutions with theoretically guaranteed uniqueness, continuity, and even differentiability properties. Regularization is illustrated in an analysis of the limiting Gaussian likelihood functions of two analytically tractable models.

translated_title: 线性有理预期模型的谱方法研究
translated_abstract: 本文在一般条件下考虑线性有理预期模型的频域问题。本文发展了特定和一般系统存在唯一性的必要和充分条件，并将所有解的空间刻画为频域中的仿射空间。研究表明，解通常不连续，这使得主流的频率派和贝叶斯方法失效，这个问题的不适定性促进了理论上保证独特性、连续性甚至可微性的正则解。本文对两个分析性可处理模型的极限高斯似然函数的分析中给出了正则化的例子。
tldr: 本文研究了线性有理预期模型，在频域下提出了正则化解，在解的唯一性、连续性和可微性方面提供了理论保证。
en_tdlr: This paper studies linear rational expectations models and proposes regularized solutions in the frequency domain to guarantee the uniqueness, continuity, and even differentiability of the solutions. Necessary and sufficient conditions for existence and uniqueness are developed. Regularization is demonstrated by analyzing the limiting Gaussian likelihood functions of two analytically tractable models.
